title: Seattle officer recorded joking about woman's death, saying 'she had limited value'
description: In bodycam footage, the officer is heard making callous remarks about a woman who died after being hit by a police cruiser. He reportedly told investigators he was mocking what city lawyers might say.

title: An inside account of devastation and survival in the Libya floods
description: Huda Akram is a doctor based in Benghazi, Libya, whose family hails from Derna. She spoke to NPR on Wednesday, describing the harrowing scenes and what is happening now.

title: Ready to test your might? The new Mortal Kombat has arrived
description: "Mortal Kombat 1" is a complete reboot — but with all the fan favorites back and ready to fight.

title: 'Oldest start-up on earth': Birkenstock's IPO filing is exactly as you'd expect
description: "We are serving a primal need of all human beings," Birkenstock's CEO writes to prospective shareholders. "We are a footbed company selling the experience of walking as intended by nature."

title: In 'The Enchanters' James Ellroy brings Freddy Otash into 1960s L.A.
description: The Enchanters marks the return of Freddy O — a disgraced ex-LAPD cop and Confidential magazine dirt digger turned shifty private investigator and Hollywood fixer — and introduces Marilyn Monroe.

title: Climate change exacerbates deadly floods worldwide
description: Climate change makes deadly floods, like what happened in Libya, more likely. Floods in China, Greece and Brazil in recent weeks underscore the growing danger.

title: As Hurricane Lee churns off the eastern U.S., another danger lurks: rip currents
description: Over the last ten years, rip currents have killed more people in the United States than tornadoes or hurricanes. This year has already been particularly bad with 76 deaths reported through August.

title: Women fight abortion bans in 3 more states with legal actions
description: Patients and doctors in Tennessee, Idaho and Oklahoma are taking legal action against state abortion bans. Women told dramatic stories of dangerous pregnancies and delayed care.

title: A Mexican ufologist claims to show 2 alien corpses to Congress
description: It's not the first time Jaime Maussan has claimed to discover "nonhuman" bodily remains, and scientists have previously dismissed them.

title: San Francisco considers lifting the Ferry Building by 7 feet to save it from the sea
description: The Ferry Building has been a beacon to incoming ferry riders since the late 1890s. Threatened by rising sea levels, the waterfront city is considering drastic measures to save its historic shoreline.

title: Sen. Mitt Romney says he won't run for a second term
description: Utah Republican Sen. Mitt Romney announced Wednesday that he will not seek reelection in 2024. "While I'm not running for reelection, I'm not retiring from the fight," he said.

title: 'NY Times' reporter details the struggle within the military to modernize its forces
description: The Army and Navy are testing new weapons that rely on cutting-edge technology and AI. Journalist Eric Lipton explains the benefits, risks and ethical questions surrounding these weapons.

title: McCarthy's plans for impeachment don't appear to be tamping down shutdown threat
description: A group of hard-line House Republicans say House Speaker Kevin McCarthy, R-Calif., cannot win their support on spending by launching an impeachment inquiry into President Biden.

title: Rep. Lauren Boebert was escorted out of 'Beetlejuice' over reports of rude behavior
description: The Colorado Republican said she was guilty of laughing and singing too loud. A report from the theater, citing four complaints from the audience, said she was also vaping and recording video.

title: More than 5,000 have been found dead after Libya floods
description: In the coastal city of Derna, dams broke, sending a torrent of water that submerged whole neighborhoods. Rescue efforts are complicated by the fact that Libya is divided between rival governments.

title: Sky-high CEO pay is in focus as workers everywhere are demanding higher wages
description: As autoworkers' real wages fall, top executives at the Big Three carmakers continue to earn tens of millions of dollars each year — hundreds of times more than the median employee.

title: Kim Jong Un vows full support for Russia as Putin pledges space tech for North Korea
description: In a summit in Russia, President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un showed how geopolitical tensions have brought the two neighbors isolated by the West into closer alignment.

title: Danelo Cavalcante has now been captured, Pennsylvania police say
description: After eluding a manhunt for nearly two weeks, convicted murderer Danelo Cavalcante has been captured, the Pennsylvania State Police announced Wednesday morning.

title: Up First briefing: Biden impeachment inquiry; Libya flood; ineffective decongestants
description: Republicans begin a formal impeachment inquiry into President Biden. Aid groups rush to Libya after catastrophic flooding. FDA advisers say a decongestant in common cold medicines doesn't work.

title: The latest COVID boosters are in for the fall. Here's what that means for you
description: NPR's Ari Shapiro speaks with Dr. Robert Wachter about the latest round of FDA-approved COVID-19 boosters and how people should think about the coronavirus and its risk.

title: North Korea's Kim vows full support for Russia's 'sacred fight' after meeting Putin
description: The leaders met at Russia's Vostochny Cosmodrome for a summit that underscores how their interests are aligning in the face of their countries' separate, intensifying confrontations with the U.S.

title: Top tech leaders are to meet with U.S. senators on the future of AI regulation
description: More than 20 CEOs, including tech titans Elon Musk, Mark Zuckerberg and Bill Gates, will meet with U.S. senators for a closed-door meeting.

title: The new COVID boosters are coming: Here's what you need to know
description: Updated versions of the mRNA vaccines roll out this week. Experts say they offer good protection against current COVID variants. Who should get them, and when's the best time to roll up your sleeve?

title: Why the transition to electric cars looms large in UAW talks with Big 3 automakers
description: Wages, benefits and job security may be at the heart of union talks with Detroit automakers — but the rise of battery-powered cars looms large in the background.

title: 4 reasons why your car insurance premium is soaring
description: The cost of car insurance has jumped nearly 18% in the last year, far outpacing overall inflation. There are                                         several reasons why that's happening.

title: After months on the market, 'The Brady Bunch' house sells for $3.2 million
description: HGTV, which bought the house in 2018, paid well over asking then poured nearly $2 million into a renovation to recreate the 1970s set. But it seems nostalgia was not enough to cover the asking price.

title: Biden loves to talk about unions. But the autoworkers are withholding their affection
description: Most of the country's big unions have already endorsed President Biden for reelection. But not the United Auto Workers. A looming strike draws attention to this tension.

title: Drew Barrymore dropped as National Book Awards host
description: Drew Barrymore has been dropped as host of the upcoming National Book Awards ceremony, a day after her talk show taped its first episode since the Hollywood writers strike began.

title: A popular nasal decongestant doesn't actually relieve congestion, FDA advisers say
description: The FDA asked advisers to take another look at phenylephrine, which became the main drug in over-the-counter decongestants when medicines with an older ingredient were moved behind pharmacy counters.
